item.title: I can't get rid of this error
item.dc:creator: @WhiteShadow WhiteShadow
item.description:
@WhiteShadow wrote:

C’mon people I’m not that noob. Of course I remembered to put variable. xD

Well I solved the problem, I’m not sure how either, I just deleted sections of it. Like the while do part’s. I don’t know at first it had to do with not being able to include, then it was not being able to use InFight then it was while do shit. I don’t know it was horrible, I nagged Pyro to help but he couldn’t find the error either. So at the end I just deleted alot of parts in my script. I’m still not sure what it was. I guess it was just like a weird runtime, all shit and awkward errors.

[code]{--------------------------------------------------------------------]
| A WhiteShadow Productions |
[--------------------------------------------------------------------]
| NAME : CowKillerHideBanker |
| CATEGORY : Fighting + Collecting |
| AUTOCOLOR : Yes |
| MSN CONTACT : redshadowsx@hotmail.com |
| SRL VER. : 2.40 |
| AUTOCOLOR : No, there are some colors to pick |
±------------------------[Description]------------------------------+
| Kills cows in South of Falador in the farming area, and collects|
| the hides, then walks to the east fally bank and banks them. |
±------------------------[Instructions]-----------------------------+
| 1. Use Runescape Client |
| 2. Put all players in the East Falador Bank. |
| 3. Drag crosshair to Runescape client, then press play. |
| 4. Fill in the forms |
[--------------------------------------------------------------------}
program HideBanker;
{.include SRL/SRL.Scar}
{.include SRL/SRL/Skill/Fighting.Scar}

var
Cow : array[0…4] of Integer;
Hide: array[0…2] of Integer;[/code]

Here was the top 20 + or so lines of my script for those who still want to see…

Read full topic

item.title: I can't get rid of this error
item.dc:creator: @King_Keen King Keen
item.description:
@King_Keen wrote:

It is probably caused by you forgetting to put var; above you variables.
It seems weird that it gives you the error on line one.

If you still have the problem could you post the top of the script… like the comments, includes, variables and constanants. Then seeing the problem should be easy.

item.title: I can't get rid of this error
item.dc:creator: @WhiteShadow WhiteShadow
item.description:
@WhiteShadow wrote:

Line 1: [Error] (1:1): Variable Expected in script C:\Program Files\SCAR 2.03\Scripts\Fighter.scar

I can’t seem to get rid of this error. :P, Line 1 is the just the comments. //like this.
So I deleted it and then it said line 0 blah blah.

It seems to only go away, when I delete {.include SRL\SRL.Scar}
